item.title: Give Back My Data
item.description: First, go watch John Oliver on data brokers. That segment opened my eyes to a problem I was aware of but had no idea of the scope. I immediately started researching how I could take better control of my data. It isn’t easy, and in some cases is impossible or will result in a major decrease in digital quality-of-life. So I’ve set out on this journey to see if cutting ties with organizations that sell my data is even possible, and I’m documenting it so you can try for yourself.

item.title: Terraform Infrastructure as Code with Reusable Modules
item.description: Terraform Infrastructure as Code with Reusable Modules and How it Can Improve Organization What is Infrastructure as Code? Infrastructure as Code (IAC) is a software-based approach to managing and provisioning infrastructure. It uses templates, automation, and a declarative language to describe the infrastructure components needed to run any application. IAC enables developers to manage their entire IT infrastructure in code. There are a few options to choose from depending on project requirements.
